39500797.review:
玩了30多个小时，差一关通关了，说说个人对这个游戏的感受。游戏的整体玩法，剧情，画面都属上乘，因为用手柄玩的，所以视角调节简直了，高度时高时低，中心视角有时候可以用，有时候就是个摆设，需要用到中心视角的时候，切半天切不回去，不知道是不是BUG，还有一点就是读取的速度，也是没谁了。
游戏整体需要玩家非常好的耐心，本人比较喜欢这类游戏，像狙击精英啊这种都是考验细心，耐心的游戏，可玩到这个游戏，我发现我的耐心一点都不好，对于强迫症外加完美主义者的我来说，一关死几十次，存档几十次，读档几十次都是正常的，因为要操控两到三个人物，所以相互间的配合，时机的掌握，都必须恰到好处，我是不知道，官方设置的一关20分钟过，要怎样去完成，我是一周目，所以没试过行不行。
总之，游戏可玩性很高，但如果你是个急性子，暴脾气，就不适合这款游戏了，建议去看看视频就好，自己入手就算了，气疯到时其次，主要的是你会有砸电脑的冲动。

39500476.review:
I'm just writing a quick review before sleeping. With time, I will give a further analysis.

[h1]Average Score: 7.2/10
Personal Score: [b][u]A[/u][/b]. It's a [b]MUST HAVE[/b][/h1]

This game is [b][u]TOTALLY AWESOME![/u][/b] Just make sure it fits your tastes. 

Consider the following characteristics:

[list][*]Isometric graphics
[*]Mouse controlled movement
[*]Tactical stealth action
[*]Multi Character Management
[*]Lots of hotkeys and Action queueing 
[/list]

If you enjoyed reading these tags, this game is honey to you. Otherwise, please watch some video reviews and gameplays. [b]This may not be your game!!![/b]

Quick review averages:
[list][*][b]General:[/b]
[list][*][b]Mechanics: 7.5/10.[/b] Mostly good. Sometimes you'll get frustrated with some miss clicks, but the game does have the feedbacks. It could be improved tho.

[*][b] Graphics: 7.5/10.[/b] Great, optimized, with cartoon shader. Biggest let down that I can't zoom too close tho. Probably because of the graphic quality, characters may look low poly from really close up. 

[*][b]Content/Surprises: 7/10.[/b] So far, not many surprises, but a lot of new content introduced every stage. Been kept entertained. [b]⚠Bear in mind that I have not beat the game yet.⚠[/b]

[*][b]Lore/Story: 7/10[/b] Nice Edo Japan story. Well set, I read almost every main dialogue. I'm usually not even attracted to stories in general, so this in one is good. But nothing extremely amazing so far.[b]⚠Bear in mind that I have not beat the game yet.⚠[/b]

[*][b]Music/Sound: 7/10.[/b] It's hard for a game to have a music that does not bore after 10 hours. I consider this an average.
[/list]

[*]Plus and Cons:

[list]
[*][b]+Voice acting: 8.5/10.[/b] Voice acting is so amazing, pushing this game score up. Just wish there was subtitles even for the random chatter characters say when you give them actions. Soldiers have limited voices, but only noticeable if you're picky (like me).

[*][b]-Scum saving: 6/10.[/b] Let's be fair: Most of the coolest games you've played after 2007 are prone to scum saving, and most of the time, because we want something to go extremely perfect. This game it's not that hard to actually make you scum save, but if you want a situation to go down exactly how you picture it, you'll F5/F8 a lot.
[/list]
[/list]
[h1]I recommend buying it...
[list]
[*]If you're into the tags mentioned above.
[*]If the game's on sale, and you liked it, but does not have the money.
[/list]
Dont buy it...
[list]
[*]If you're not into the tags, or is just curious. Look for the bad reviews, and watch some videos, to be sure.
[/list]
[/h1]

40962256.review:
Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun is a stealth-action tactical strategy game set in feudal Japan with tight gameplay reminiscent of Jagged Alliance 2, Commandos and Silent Storm.

Pros
- Gameplay is fair but challenging and requires a lot of thinking but also quick reflexes.
- Feudal Japan is the perfect setting for a modern evolution of this line of classic games.
- Each level forces you to make use of specific characters and as such keeps the gameplay fresh throughout.
- Great visuals that remind you of japanese paintings sort of (Okami-esque).
- Instant panty drop for any true weeb.

Cons
- VO is great for the most part but sometimes it's not so good.

If you are a weeb or are interested in playing a great game inspired by the classic JA2/Commandos games then you can't go wrong with Shadow Tactics: Blade of the Shogun.

40961129.review:
Short version: Awesome game for it's genre, worth it's price, don't even wait for discount, 10/10

Long version: 
Shadow Tactics: BotS is a masterpiece by itself. The fluent gameplay, easy to learn mechanics, lots and lots of solutions to your problems and the way it makes your brain overheat is spectacular. Add to that the great voice acting with deep characterization, nice graphics, good enemy ai plus no bugs whatsoever and you have a great game. The producers didn't forget achievements and different objectives for replayability too. 
So by far the game easily gets 9 or 10 points. But it's not only that. Each point below gives the game another point (which makes it beyond 10 point in my case)

-If you have played the predecessors (Commandos and Desperados series) and have a craving for this genre
-If you're a japanese culture / anime freak like me (if so definitely play the game with japanese voice acting)
-If you're a sucker for great soundtrack 
then please stop reading and start playing already.

40792997.review:
I can highly recommend this game to everyone who enjoys stealth.
The game feels like it is a big jigsaw and you are finding a way to deconstruct it.
It gets especially fun when you have more than 2 characters on your team since there are multiple ways to get to an objective.
Each person's special talents are awesome and it feels that they are will balanced, none of the characters feel "weak"
When it comes to the story I was engaged and eager to see the next part after completing a mission.
Graphics are beautiful and very detailed, a bit too detailed at times when it happens that during a shadow move you get blocked by a bucket and have to reload... watch out for those buckets!!

My one gripe is that I didnt like the "slow down" during those times when enemies spot you. a constant high in and out speed would have been prefered by me.
While facing tough enemies remember that a bit of flute + trap can do wonders!

Enjoy the game!

40783730.review:
Es war ja langsam mal wieder Zeit für ein hochwertig produziertes Echtzeit-Taktik-Spiel im Stil von "Commandos" oder "Desperados". Und nach 15-jähriger Abstinenz kam dan mit Shadow Tactics ein Nachfolger im Geiste, der einfach mal alles richtig macht.

Es gibt fünf verschiedene Charaktere, die allesamt unterschiedliche Fähigkeiten besitzen. Es gibt einen Ninja, eine Fallenstellerin, eine Verkleidungskünstlerin, einen Scharfschützen und einen Samurai fürs Grobe. Die Missionen sind so aufgebaut, dass die Fähigkeiten aller eingesetzten Figuren sinnvoll miteinander kombiniert werden können und müssen. Teilweise muss man auch mehrere Figuren gleichzeit in Aktion treten lassen, was durch ein praktisches Kombinationstool erleichtert wird und nach Ausführung für eine ganz besondere Befriedigung sorgt. Man fühlt sich einfach wie ein super Taktiker und Planer, wenn mal wieder ein Plan funktioniert und eine knifflige Situation durch die eigene subjektive Genialität gelöst wurde. Zudem gibt es stets verschiedene Wege, um an sein Ziel zu kommen. So kann man beispielsweise, je nach Spielstil, das Ziel einfach umklatschen oder es etwas subtiler gestalten und heimlich den Tee vergiften. Sehr schön. Hinzu kommen unterschiedliche Gegebenheiten, die jeweils Auswirkungen auf die Taktik bzw. das Vorgehen haben. Bei Regen macht man lautere Schrittgeräusche, bei Dunkelheit ist man abseits von Fackeln und Laternen komplett getarnt und im Schnee hinterlässt man Spuren. Jede Karte bietet somit eine neue Situation in die man sich hineindenken muss.

Das Szenario ist sicherlich Geschmacksache. Ich persönlich kann mit dem feudalen Japan jetzt nicht soviel anfangen, obgleich ich den Machern zugestehen muss, dass sie die Zeit sehr schön umgesetzt haben. Was man hier an Kultur und Gebäuchen mitbekommt, beschränkt sich zwar im Groben auf das, was man auch aus Samurai-Filmen kennt, und auch die Handlung ist eher einfach, aber das Hauptaugenmerk liegt ohnehin auf dem perfekt ausbalancierten Gameplay.

Klare Empfehlung.

40771639.review:
An unfortunately short game despite how amazing it is. 
Pros: 
-Solid graphics. Everything that's needed is portrayed beautifully in this artsyle and animation
-Near perfect mechanics for a stealth based RTS. Of course things like range and line of sight are unrealistic but that's part of the genre
-In true RTS fashion, theres dozens of ways to deal with a mission. I spent about 1.5 hours per mission with about half that time contemplating different options and switching between them because I changed my mind. There's even a pacifist route which is insanely hard because the enemies wake up soon after you take them out.
-Controls are really fluid. I played with a controller and its really easy to control the characters and take advantage of the slightest of openings in what seems to be impossible situations. 
-Character development is top notch considering how little they actually talk. I honestly like all the characters, even the villians
-Plot is paced well and is overall good enough to make me actually feel emotions

Cons:
-There was this one bug that forced me to restart a mission because an essential element was stuck while climbing a ladder
-Really short. Only 10 missions I think, but that's enough to tell a decent story and have a very satisfying ending.
-Initial loading times for me for each mission was about 5 minutes. I'm not mad about that because I imagine that's what makes the game able to handle such large areas at once. 

Result: Very great stealth RTS that can only improve by a sequel or more content.

40747403.review:
Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun - одна из тех игр, в которые влюбляешься сразу и надолго. У игры интересный сюжет, колоритные персонажи (японская озвучка прекрасно передает их характеры) и атмосфера, которую делают потрясающая музыка и работа художников.

Отдельно хочется похвалить дизайн локаций. Он не просто является элементом декора, он напрясмую влияет на геймплей, делая каждый уровень уникальным. В одной миссии идет снег и персонажи оставляют следы. В другой царит ночь, в третьей — льет ливень Каждая локация имеет свою изюминку.

Способности каждого из персонажей очень полезные и, казалось бы, самодостаточные (ну кроме разве что Такумы, который чистой воды суппорт), однако уровни построены так, что их нельзя пройти, вырезая всех вокруг одним персонажем. Ключ к победе  - командная работа. Пожалуй ни в одной игре прежде у меня не было такого ощущения плеча — ощущения, что ты командуешь слаженным отрядом, а не просто набором юнитов.

Минусы у игры, к сожалению, тоже есть, однако они не портят общего впечатления. Первый минус - это оооочень долгие загрузки уровней. Проблема решилась, когда мне посоветовали поставить патч v2 в бета версии (внимание! старые сейвы слетят, но перепроходить игру не надо, достаточно начать заново последнюю миссию, на которой вы остановились). С версией v2 все стало летать, поэтому данный пункт мы в расчет не берем.

Второй момент — это не самая удобная камера. Иногда она начинает скакать при увеличении/уменьшении, из-за чего ты теряешь драгоценные секунды. Третий момент — это отсутствие тактической паузы. А она тут ой как нужна, поскольку речь идет о тактике в реальном времени. 

Здесь есть режим тени, позволяющий спланировать одно действие каждому персонажу, но одного действия мало. Мне нужно не просто синхронно убить трех противников, которые стоят в поле зрения друг друга. Мне нужно убить их и тут же затащить в ближайшие кусты, пока не подошел патруль, однако теневой режим (который к тому же не замедляет и не останавливает время) дает возможность только для одного действия. Убийство прошло как по маслу, но дальше тебе приходится судорожно отдавать приказы персонажам в режиме реального времени - прятаться самим или прятать тела. 

Ну и последнее - не хочу показаться казуалом, но игра слишком уж хардкорная. Врагов на локации очень много и почти все они видят друг друга. Тем не менее, я прошел игру запоем и, несмотря на дикую попоболь на некоторых уровнях, я получил колоссальное удовольствие от игры. Если вам нравятся тактики и вы без ума от Японии (как я), обязательно берите. Это игра штучной выделки.

40729370.review:
Good with some caveats.

To be clear, I love that this game was made. I enjoy tactical games and am fascinated by Japanese culture and history. Clearly the developers enjoyed designing the levels and characters of the game and overall the production and attention to detail is admirable. I initially thought this was going to be a game I come back to over and over again but after a few levels it was clear this wasn't going to be the case.

Pros: Level designs are all different, mostly interesting and populated with various guards and enemies. Some tactical planning and quick thinking/execution is required to excel at the game. Production is well done. Story is serviceable and fits the characters and setting, if not surprising or deep.

Cons: It feels more like a puzzle game than a tactical game. If you've played the hitman mobile games you'll know what I'm talking about. You have some freedom but the options to distract and sneak by are limited. Memorizing/anticipating guard movements is key, which is not inherently bad, but it gets monotonous, because that is what you'll be doing the entire time. Distract guards, sneak by, kill: Repeat. Coordinating attacks with different characters does feel rewarding and there is some decent tension created in a well timed combo. However, the controls are just awkward enough for you to be stressed out about them just as much as the samurai you know are about to turn a corner.

Verdict: Overall I liked the game and would recommend it. I like the setting and the blending of genres. It really isn't as much of a tactical game as I would have liked, though the elements are there. The guard vision puzzles are the meat of the game and lost some of their luster about half-way through. But there is enough variety with your characters to make solving the puzzles fun and satisfying.

40713271.review:
What I love most is when a genre is revived by people who really truly understand it. The developers of Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun clearly understood why the classic tactics stealth games like Commandos worked. It has always been a very niche small genre, seemingly influenced by both real time tactics classics like Myth series and by the stealth titles like Metal Gear, and it hasn't seen any truly worthy successors for years. Even later Commandos games and the similar Desperados games usually never got the same love and praise the original titles did and some (citation needed) might even claim those games to "not get it" as well. But Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun? Now this game gets it. And I suck at it pretty badly, as expected.

In case you are not familiar with this specific subgenre of real time tactics games, the general concept of games like this is about having a small team of people, all with unique skills, who have to accomplish a specific goal on a map full of enemy (and sometimes neutral) NPC characters, preferably in a stealthy way, since otherwise they die very easily. Games are almost always with a top down view, lots of hotkeys and controls common to strategy games and top down RPGs. In Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun in particular, the camera can also be rotated, but some older titles had pre-set view angle. Enemies have view cones your characters should avoid, awareness levels, they can hear certain sounds made and generally behave as usual for a classic stealth game, most closely resembling the first few MGS titles. Your resources are usually limited, with most effective and powerful skills and tools being limited (sometimes with an ability to get more stuff on the map) and usually the whole concept of any map is about figuring out how to approach each segment in the most efficient stealthy way, while trying not to make things worse for yourself for later segments.

And, as mentioned, Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun really gets it. Every character is unique enough to be highly useful for certain tasks, while never feeling underutilized for a particular mission they are available for. Some character skills overlap, but never to a point where you can easily substitute a character for another. Maps utilize various special conditions and tricks to keep gameplay varied. And the game introduces a really cool mode, where you can give your characters commands in an "active pause" type of manner and then execute all queued commands at once. The developers also tried to remove all the usual pitfalls of the genre, so you can easily quicksave and quickload (there's even a reminder with a timer since last time you've saved), highlight or hide enemy and interactive object outlines and combine several separate actions into one.

That said, some things remain frustrating. Yet again, for a top down camera game where you can rotate the camera, I had lots of issues with it because you need to rotate the camera, not just "can" do it. If you use quick rotation buttons, you would sometimes be still unable to select the moving spot you wish, because of a very narrow spot your character is in. It's sometimes really hard to tell if you're on a different elevation level in comparison to something you want to go to, with characters refusing to move if it is. Sometimes hiding bodies doesn't seem to work outright if you queue the action to the edge of the hiding spot or perform several actions at once. And the game is actually performing rather averagely for a title that doesn't look that fantastic, and still has some bugs. Though at the moment of me writing this a new patch has just been released for beta (2 years since game release), which promises to fix the technical issues.

I sucked at Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun more often than I didn't. But I loved it. It's a well made love letter to a genre that needs to be revived, that accepts the fact that you need to abuse the hell out of saves on your first playthroughs a lot to not get mad at the game. And just makes it as fun to do as possible. I hope these developers make more games, learning from the experience of this title. And I hope more developers show their love for the real time stealth tactics, because it's one of those genres/subgenres that needs more love.

Espectacular, una maravilla que se recupere este género, espero de alguna manera que se convierta en una saga.

Por si no conoces la saga Commandos, es un juego de infiltración  y estrategia en tiempo real, donde manejas un pequeño grupo de personajes. Cada uno dispone de una serie de habilidades y caracteristicas; ataques a distancia, cuerpo a cuerpo, mas rapidos o silenciosos, esa clase de cosas. Tendras un objetivo y un monton de enemigos con algunas peculiaridades que te lo impiden.

Como contra hay que decir que es un poco corto, son solo 13 misiones. Aunque la rejugabilidad es interesante.

40575123.review:
This is one of those hidden gem games, a game that should of seriously got some good advertisement out there just to show players even a brief glimpse of the game.

I've always been a bit partial to top down rts games, I've loved some old school games and honestly not played any recently either, this was bought as a gift for me by my brother that watched a few videos and thought he'd take the chance on getting it for me, safe to say it was money well spent.

You can control up to 5 characters on a mission, each mission varies on which characters you have control of and of course how many of them acompany you, they all have 2 active skills each that behave very differently and will aid you in getting past the obstacles of enemies, such as being able to use a bird call with one character after having planted a bear trap on the ground (though you have to be very careful that guards or civilians don't see that enemy being killed) along with also a couple "passives" exclusive to each chararacter, such as how they can drag unconscious/dead enemies, ability to climb up vines, or even killing a samurai.

The story is quite interesting, though unfortunately the "cut-scenes" lack any real depth and instead just use the normal games camera and animations, no special effects here. Fortunately for me, none of that took away from the game for me as I was quite interested just in the story as if I was reading a book, and more importantly just wanting to simply play the game and experience each map and see in what ways I can tackle each obstacle.

Speaking about obstacles though, once you've completed each level, you will see a bunch of challenges appear that can increase the replayability and challenge you to do each of the things listed, though decently enough you can find your self accidently doing a few of them on your first playthrough anyway, and on many missions I thought of other ways I could of done the missions that didn't even involve the challenges anyway.

All in all, I'd give it a solid 8/10 for the story and gameplay, if it had a more interesting way of delivering the story I would honestly give it a 10/10 for those that enjoy rts games like this.

[h1]井蛙不可语海，夏虫不可语冰[/h1]
这个硬核向游戏深刻的让我认识到了什么叫人外有人。
自己玩每关都要一两个小时，杀一个人就赶紧保存一下觉得自己牛逼坏了，结算的时候看着徽章要求10分钟通关的条件心想这怎么可能呢？？？

40515010.review:
[b]"Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun"[/b] я не могу назвать по-настоящему плохой игрой, но и, думаю, не каждый ее оценит по достоинству. Я вот, например, не оценил.

Поначалу проект меня заинтересовал своей концепцией и, поведясь на сугубо положительные отзывы, я решил приобрести сие творение. Но как оказалось с выводами я поспешил. Не ходя вокруг да около, свою основную претензию к игре я выражу так - она ОЧЕНЬ скучная.

Коротенько в чем суть - "Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun" представляет собой тактический стелс с изометрической камерой, где нам под управление дают аж пятерых персонажей, у каждого из которых свои особенности, свои гаджеты и умения. Уровни весьма обширные, наполненные кучей противников, предметами, с которыми можно взаимодействовать, подобием обходных путей и все такое прочее. При этом жизненно необходимо использовать способности героев по максимуму, для этого есть даже специальный режим для их совместных действий, который позволяет нажатием одной кнопки заставить всех подвластных тебе человечков бегать и выполнять то, что ты им наприказывал до этого. Звучит все это замечательно и интересно, собственно на это я и повелся при покупке, но на деле все несколько печальней.

Итак, прежде всего, локации хоть и достаточно внушительные, зачастую дают лишь иллюзию вариативности прохождения и представляют собой не открытую площадку, как, например, в последнем MGS (хоть сравнение и несколько некорректное), а обычный коридор с ответвлениями. О какой тактике вообще может идти речь, когда к конечной цели можно подобраться лишь по одному пути? Непонятно. При этом сами миссии жрут непозволительно много времени - в среднем на прохождение одного задания уходит около часа.

Вторая проблема собственно в изометрической камере. Я понимаю, это вполне подходящее для такого проекта решение, но чем хороши игры жанра "стелс", так это возможностью ощутить себя в шкуре крадущегося тигра, затаившегося кролика. Когда ты выверяешь каждый шаг своего экранного протагониста, осторожно заглядываешь за угол, сидишь под столом, видя ноги какого-нибудь охранника, стоящего рядом, неожиданно обнаруживаешь какую-нибудь вентиляционную шахту - все это дает очень крутой экспириенс и игровой персонаж ощущается как-то ближе. Здесь подобного, так скажем, погружения, нет и в помине. Камера болтается где-то в небесах, давая прекрасный обзор всей карты, всех находящихся рядом противников и все укрытия, а бездушное тыканье мышкой для перемещения попросту на дает почувствовать героя.

Третья проблема, достойная упоминания, это непосредственно враги. Безусловно, не все игры могут похвастаться вменяемым ИИ, и многие игры жанра "стелс" тоже грешат такой проблемой, но здесь вся скрытность сведена к соблюдению условностей поведения противников. Грубо говоря, у каждого противника есть своеобразный "конус видимости", в рамках которого он способен заметить игрока. Формально ты можешь встать в сантиметре от того места, где заканчивается край этого "конуса" и делать буквально что угодно, хоть танцевать чечетку на трупах - и останешься незамеченным. Но пододвинешься на этот сантиметр правее - окажешься в поле зрения противника. Я повторюсь, многие игры грешат подобным, но здесь на мой взгляд это просто возведено в абсолют. И как я уже сказал, весь стелс, вся "тактика" сводится не столько к комбинированию возможностей героев, не столько к обходным путям, сколько к обнаружению и использованию таких вот "слепых зон".

Где-то после третьей миссии я внезапно понял, что единственное чувство, которое вызывает у меня "Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun", это скука. Даже не раздражение, а просто обычная скука. Игра честно старается быть интересной и разнообразной, вводя новый вид противников, постепенно включая в действие новых персонажей, оставляя на картах возможности подстроить несчастные случаи в духе лысого из Агентства, да и в целом есть весьма интересные и оригинальные находки, но все это все равно проект не спасает. Это исключительная субъективщина, кому-то вероятно игра придется по вкусу, но точно не мне.

I struggled through the game, usually taking between 2-4 hours on every mission. I carefully planned every move, controling only one character at a time. I balked at the achievements- how could a mission be done in 20 minutes? How could you do it without killing anyone?

After I finished the game, I watched videos of people doing all the badges, and wow... I was blown away by the speed and precision of some people. Quite possibly the best tactical stealth implementation I've ever played. 40463296.review:
对于RTT爱好者来说，这游戏肯定一看宣传就无脑入了也不用多说，对此感兴趣的玩家还是推荐首先收个盟军大包，爽完入坑还想爽就入赏金奇兵，最后是影子战术（仅从花费来讲）。至于本作素质，赏金1，盟军2（使命召唤还是关卡太少）和影战在我心里差不多是三杰了，也就这仨（当然意犹未尽还可以跑去玩1937啊，罗宾汉啊，再远点可以算二战英雄和铁血联盟，STEAM上也有一些同类不过这要靠挖掘了）。不过大致来讲，这算是独苗了，无论如何都应该玩那种。

本作一共13关，除去教学1关之外没有滥竽充数的，一周目开荒普通难度+屠城怎么地都要1个小时朝上，倒不用担心玩不够本，难度方面，普通难度不考虑成就赏金>影战>盟2，全成就算是目前此类型最难（这类成就只会出现在当年那群骨灰挑战自我给自己设卡那种）。单纯完成任务不屠城不追求成就的话对新人还是比较友好的，不是立刻被发现，除了老爷子其余人跑动都无声音，外加三个F5糊脸上怎么地都够了。
此类游戏最大的魅力我个人认为在于人物设计和地图设计，人物设计方面，把一个整人劈成四五半每个人都会一点来靠玩家来进行配合远比一个全能战士来得更有成就感，而地图设计不仅要突出游戏的背景，更要结合每个人物的特点，可能还需要有五种以上的通关方式。而我得到的乐趣，就在于依靠人物间的配合来解开视野覆盖的锁，全解完地图上没红点的时候带给我的是巨大的满足感，也是少有的能让我失去时间概念的游戏。
而这两点，影战可谓都做得非常优秀。
人物设计方面，五个人物算是刚好合适，而且除了大爷的狙击和换装之外居然没有太多的硬伤，说得上是很考究了，既符合时代背景又能做出各自特点又能让所有人都有用武之地是很不容易的。
1.武士，充分说明了开场的不一定是主角，这位才是。我一看这位扛尸体的动作就知道这位肯定是主角，玩剑刃风暴的时候我甚至在脑补他在嚼口香糖，五人中唯一一个香烟（清酒）战术，唯一一个能扛重物，这已经很贝雷帽和库伯了。
2.伊贺忍者，由于刀法迅速和手里剑能开无双的只有他一个，虽然同类里有比石头BUG的狸猫但是老爷子只能爬梯子加上能扔基本上是开路先锋。
3.信浓忍者，只要有衣服，就能屠城。但本作盖世太保实在烦的不像话。
4.小偷，陷阱+浣熊克一切，三人小队只有两个人这是常识，旁边要再跟着扔手里剑的这就只剩一个了。笛子的唯一缺点就是必须原地吹了。
5.大爷，大爷还是大爷，狙击枪现拼科技树怕是走到一战了，外加手雷+BUG浣熊，算是本作最贴近全能的了，然后砍了近战游泳+攀爬直接导致没什么存在感，此类游戏这是头一个让我感觉狙击枪子弹用不完的。
相比NPC的各种不历史，主角队意外的很历史了，除了游戏设计（一把手里剑明显是不让你从头到尾就用一个人）之外没有什么超纲的地方，对于一个德国制作组而言这很足够了。而且，你看，牛顿他在笑啊。
地图设计方面，可以说该有的全有了，要攻城大场面有，要忍者场景，有，同时也结合队里两个忍者一个贼，导致每一张图都是高低立体作战，少有的结合背景，人物和玩法的地图设计。不过只说一点就够了，这类游戏中能把时间限制直接体现的，都是对地图设计有自信的，而他们确实做到了。
地图细节也足够丰富，对地图的互动不仅仅体现在成就，而且会很便利（比如牛踢佛像武士会被引开），而最基本的，黑夜视野减小但是光源处是浅绿，灭光会拉人雪地脚印会引来侦查（拉武士），水塘处声音巨大，可以说这些细节的重要性是能够直接影响到基础玩法的。
而游戏本身鼓励玩家潜行通关，相比较盟2一言不合就大打阵地战和赏金长枪短炮都有对射随机数不算落下风，影战敌人不仅科技占优（一战的轻武器），被敌人发现全城警报+增援可以说是官方推荐潜行了。
敌人方面影战算是目前敌人最强一类的了，帽子这种很满大街的已经不吃位移技能，而武士盖世太保的设定，不吃大部分技能不说，特定方法击杀和限人击杀只能让人想到装甲单位（忍者干不过武士这很历史），但这玩意一局能给你整快十个就能让你彻底放弃浪一把的想法了。本作敌人刻画的也足够出彩，少有的下功夫，比如帽子不吃清酒要么说我戒酒了或者坚守岗位，武士就直接：清酒，这东西我也有啊，不为清酒折腰这类。可以说不是为了设定而设定，是让你觉得自然而然能想通的（比如为什么无限有清酒因为这位也是武士）。
剧情方面，影战下了功夫，过场动画不提，每关的来龙去脉交代的清楚，人物感情培养合格到位，外加埋了续作的伏笔，足够了（这类游戏也就赏金也是一条线下来的，盟军就满世界乱窜了）而难能可贵的是一个德国制作组搞日本历史搞得算是像模像样（你瞅瞅帝国3的中国），一个游戏切腹切四个还配介错试问现在哪个这类背景的游戏能做到？连本子自己的制作组都不会做这类吧（当然他们的忍者目前要么朝R18狂奔，要么气死牛顿）

音乐单拿出来说，有特色是有特色，主菜单的也挺好听，但业界标杆盟军敢死队在前就难免有比较，相比之下影战的音乐却是平庸，而且有的关卡就没有音乐（攻城那关打到最后只有枪声，最后我把盟3斯大林格勒的音乐放后台听了，意外带感）
配音也单拿出来说，和音乐比一个天上一个地下，相比对面战爹那被人吐了无数遍的配音，本作日配给人第一印象反而是日厂自己出的，配音极其出彩，除了无限略显年轻之外（这位怎么看都是中年大叔吧）

横向对比一下，盟军名气最大也最适合新手（要难度MOD或者玩使命召唤），贝雷帽抄烟横砍一条街（毕竟能取消动作），不过地图设计也确实好，在盟军2人手步枪冲锋枪手雷烟酒，角色同质化不可避免的时候也能整出小偷单人渗透的地图，而最大的特色就是室内场景（和历史背景，起码这类游戏再做二战肯定就是盟军如何如何）。
赏金现在还记得的就是脑洞大开了，气球毒气，衣服架子，顶着印第安兄弟脑瓜子的伪装。
影战作为赏金的全面进化版（虽然都叫皇军敢死队，但这是第一印象，其实叫幕府奇兵更贴切，具体的都玩玩就知道了），各方面都有提高，但重点的影子战术（或者说库伯的怀表），从双忍者杀五人小队到最基本的杀武士，影子战术的作用被提高到基础操作水准，而回报则是丰厚的，但观赏性就足够了（三人同时跳杀这场面足了）。

最后还是吐槽一下
一开始无限扛尸体的动作让我有个想法，这位大爷是不是能搬两个，结果这位大爷真能，不仅能还能跑，服气的。
主角队建模都很舒服，唯独爱子怎么看怎么变扭，明明伪装很漂亮而且有两套到忍者服就变扭的说不出话。
皇军敢死队其实也没错，声音圈很既视感
反派动机扯淡到让我感觉还不如狗血的弑兄夺权，这位和荣耀战魂的反派整个一天造地设。
游戏还是有BUG，比如影大人关踩沼泽地发声没问题，结果出来走平地还是发声，导致直接一个人物废了。
制作组显然是想做续作的，坑明显都挖好了
但是，你让主角死了是什么意思？无限的死基本就相当于绿色贝雷帽和库伯挂了，幸亏游戏不火火了玩家不要找你们拼命啊，盟军敢死队那老几位被纳粹抓多少次了？纳粹没把老几位贴墙边挨个崩了是主角队光环还是纳粹仁慈你们心里没点数啊（然后下一关就有五人小队简直就是伤口撒盐，绝对成心的）。

玩完之后我突然发现这游戏的武士好像都挂了，当场喷了，那价值观我也算是略有耳闻，人都有追求有理想我也不妄下断语，不过看着隔壁俩忍者活蹦乱跳的心里总不是滋味，不过想想制作组暗示和爱子有后，恩....算不亏吧

40456320.review:
盟军敢死队的精神续作，尤其是2代。想必将盟军2作为盟军系列的代表作是没有异议的，所以后面多处将本作与盟军2进行对比作浅略分析，也说说自己的游戏体会。

为了贯彻影子战术的主题，手残的本人在多个关卡追求0杀导致38小时才全部通关。本作在技能以及游戏模式上对盟军2都有继承和借鉴，或者说照搬，比如经典的敌军视野圆锥，深绿小圈，浅绿大圈，有烟来捡，有尸来看，发现报警，拒捕开枪，等等（不过本作里是改成了发现不犹豫直接开枪），任何玩过盟军2的玩家都能快速摸清套路并露出会心一笑。既然模式一致，地图大同小异，那么玩法的核心就在人物上了。


本作人物个性鲜明，隼人的孤傲，无限的忠义，爱子的柔情，友希的纯善，琢磨的睿智，都在短短的对话里体现出来，CV对此贡献不小。但由于剧情依然老套，人物脸谱和对白略为动漫化，而且五个人物对应五种颜色，又有那么一点中二的气息（XX战队之类的既视感）。对于每个人的背景交代并不清楚，比如从游戏剧情里只能看出爱子是个歌伎出身，但为何变成女忍为将军效忠却没有描述，我估计在艺术设定集里有写？可惜我没买。对比下来盟军2的人物都是有背景设定资料的，能够让人物的特征和形象更为丰满，更像是历史上真实存在过的角色。

不同于盟军2细致的职业分工，本作的团队可以粗略认为是1个冷兵器高手+1个热兵器高手+3个忍者，技能有互通性，也有唯一性。下面试对本作人物与盟军2中的人物做一个对比：

1号忍者（隼人）= 水手（飞刀）+小偷（飞檐走壁）
上手很快的人物，游戏中平衡性最好的角色，基本上别人会的他都会，而且后期只有他能扛得动人。虽然对于职业忍者出门执勤腰上只别一枚手里剑的想法不能理解[spoiler]后来看到有大佬说是因为出勤带多枚手里剑可能会产生金属碰撞声[/spoiler]，但是如果自带两枚的话这个人又变得太好用了...再说他扔石子水平超高的，每局忍不住要用个几十次，久而久之你就忘记手里剑的存在了（手里剑击杀噪音过大，后期敌军人口密度较高，在无人员配合的情况下不便于使用）。

2号萝莉（有希）= 司机（陷阱）+小偷（飞檐走壁）
相比于老司机做陷阱下套，小姑娘下套+吹箫明显更具实力，有多少耿直的小兵死在这招之下大家应该心里都有数。唯一无效的是敌军武士，踩到陷阱后会说“这是小孩子的玩具！渣渣！”，莫非他们真的是头顶有角三倍速，高达附体？但陷阱还是每局忍不住要用个十几次，主要是拐角阴暗处太适合发挥了，能有效降低杀敌成本。由于力气不够只能拖动尸体，反而有不容易被发现的优势。虽然难以接受小姑娘上阵搏命，但是战乱时期孤儿的存活之道或许就是如此吧。

题外话：在第三关，某个敌军小兵在风雪里并打喷嚏边说“该死的雪（Yuki）”的时候，我用有希（Yuki）正好爬到他身后，还真是莫名喜感，有希当时有没有打喷嚏呢（笑

3号武士（尾城无限）= 自带香烟的贝雷帽（匕首+香烟经典模式）
五人小队的核心领袖，战斗力爆表，原创技能“旋风斩”理论上可以无双干死技能范围内的所有小兵，唯一能和敌军武士刚正面的猛男。自带道具清酒=香烟，虽然我也搞不懂为何小兵看到地上有瓶清酒就一定会捡起来喝个爽...但是！二战时期的小兵也是看到东西就捡，更何况是600年前资源更为贫乏的幕府时代的小兵呢！铠甲太重导致他不能飞檐走壁，但是不穿铠甲的时候也不行，尸体和岩石都能同时抓两个，所以这是一个肌肉兄贵的典型形象，加上他对隼人热情过度对爱子又处处苏格兰调情，不得不让人浮想联翩。[spoiler]憨厚的汉子[/spoiler]

4号女忍（爱子）= 娜塔莎/间谍（伪装）+小偷（飞檐走壁）
CV声音酥是第一的，其他都是次要的，毕竟伪装早已不是什么稀奇的技能了。但伪装还是每局忍不住要用个几次，其实是为了看看花魁装束下的她到有多美？因为如果不美的话！跟男1号只有忍者和女忍者的区别而已！独占技胡椒粉范围比火枪还大，有必要加以练习，如何利用延时效果做一点微小的贡献，就看你自己把握了。[spoiler]其实很强[/spoiler]

5号老头（琢磨大师）= 狙击手（狙击）+工兵（手雷）
身残志坚、有暴力倾向的老头，他加入团队前大家都是舞刀弄剑，他加入团队后大家人手一把火枪，有些成就可能只有他能完成(比如用手雷一次炸死X个敌人之类的)。核心技能自然是狙击和爆炸，自带浣熊能救命。剧情里还展现了他擅长下药的一面，年轻时估计也是道上的大佬。但老了后对年轻人也有教诲和保护的一面，比如他不愿意让有希卷入太深，希望她不要继续参与小组的秘密行动，而代之以传授给她一点人生的经验这样。[spoiler]真的很暴力啊[/spoiler]


话虽如此，但剧情中最触动我的一幕其实是叛军屠村那关，开场动画琢磨大师在野地里的独白，凄凉，绝望，此时他所面临的情况是领队无限已被抓住拷问即将处刑，眼前的百姓被残杀却不能拔枪相助，自己身负重伤命不久矣，不甘心，真是人间炼狱！所以当有希放弃报信任务选择救援，突然出现在他面前时，希望瞬间被点亮，于是重拾信心，大狙开镜，战局逆转，甚是热血，此处情感铺垫应该说十分到位。



说说游戏的亮点：

（1）毫无疑问，影子模式是本作最大的亮点。正如标题里所写，影子战术嘛，作为将军的“走狗”，忍者小队主打的是秘密潜入，那么在封锁的环境下要完成任务，哪怕推进一步，也是需要所有人通力配合才能完成的，如果只需要一个人就能搞定所有目标，那是不符合策略游戏的宗旨的。因此本作的影子模式，对于单体来说也可以预存指令，便于快速操作。我觉得大家在玩的过程中所能获得的最大成就感，无过于看着几个队员按照自己预设的指令行云流水般搞定一组巡逻小队或执勤守卫了吧。哪怕盟军2里要实现这种操作也是要靠手动计算时间量的，影子模式大幅降低了微操的要求，但同样需要多试，毕竟不是每个玩家都有APM200+的手。

（2）忍者隐匿方式的展现。游戏中展现了很多忍者的天然优势，比如行走和跑动无噪音，无敌的蹲草丛，有一些是武士和老头做不到的。而且对环境可能发出的噪音要有所考虑，比如踩到水坑、在稻田里移动等。影子战术是鼓励秘密潜入的，一旦被发现即被射击，被射击即拉响警报，而敌军个个神枪手只要射击必中，因此血瓶的设计聊胜于无。所有关卡其实都设置成了0杀可通关的模式，当然需击杀的目标除外，但是对于大多数玩家来说应该没有那么多耐心去尝试，因此快速通关才是真正难度所在（成就党含泪膜拜各路大佬）。

（3）时代风味的展现。幕府时代的风情还是有所展现的，送酒的牛车，古朴的禅寺，节日的锦鲤，露天的浴场，和风满满。而且制作组似乎对切腹怀有执念啊！整个剧情里出现有完整动画的切腹三次，介错两次，十分写实，16禁就是因为这个血腥度过高吧？此处有唯一剧透不建议看[spoiler]没有介错的那次切腹正是主角武士尾城无限，所以游戏后面几关你永远失去了他[/spoiler]。本作中的平民十分胆小怕事，不同于盟军2里的平民在看见你杀人放火后自顾自地跑路消失在地图边缘，本作里的平民光是看见你站在他身边就要山呼报官，简直就是敌军无所不在的高能警报器，但是本着人道主义的原则，我倒是一个也没有杀过...打晕后在附近没有官爷可供报告的情况下会自己跑出地图外（不完全确定），总体来讲最好是避而远之，很明显加入平民就是为了提高整个游戏的难度，和加入会叫的鸡、会飞的鸟一样。如果真是恨得牙痒痒，不妨试试“事故杀”这种免责手段吧！[spoiler]或者扔到悬崖/厕所/粪桶[/spoiler]

[spoiler]其实只有影子模式是亮点，别的都是我编的[/spoiler]



有亮点就有缺点，再说说游戏的缺点：

（1）视角：这个应该是广为诟病的一点了，虽然视角可以无极调节，但一般惯用视角就4个，在有些场景下特定视角很难选定动作位置，导致操作频繁失误。在秘密潜入的情况下，某些路线在选定后只有唯一解，偏偏游戏的容错率又很低，所以当因为视角切换不及时反复S/L时，砸键盘的冲动还是会有的。说起来，本作支持手柄，我觉手柄的操作可能会更难？也许更想摔手柄了。

（2）翻译：游戏的翻译比较贴近现代人的习惯（似乎只是机翻？），因此在当时的语境下某些译句不是很地道。比如前期无限对有希的称呼，前期是“有希妹妹”，后期改成了“有希小妹”，都挺别扭；将军的弟弟称呼将军为“哥哥”，明显应该译为“兄长”；“草帽”“军官”是比较粗暴的直译，个人觉得像“足轻组头”“军曹”“侍大将”之类的可能更好；还有“火枪”可改为“铁炮”，“手雷”可改为“爆弹”，等等。不过这是个人感觉，也许过于吹毛求疵了，翻译在整体上是不影响游戏理解的。

（3）手感：操作手感不是很顺滑，一个熟练的盟军2玩家应该是会利用操作的，比如双击快速捆绑背起，站蹲切换快速完成特定动作等，但是本作的每个动作是严格计秒数的，好处是展现了世界的真实，坏处是玩家感受到了世界的恶意。为何我在草丛里揍草丛里的躺着的人也会被几十米开外的小兵看见？抬手这么明显？而且盯住你的时间跟动作时间匹配，一拳还没揍完就被发现了...那么，为何我要揍一个已经晕倒躺着的人？因为打了不能捆绑啊！游戏就是鼓励你偷偷进村，打枪的不要，不要被发现，不要杀人，甚至不要打人，所以压根就没设计“捆绑”这一操作，以至于打晕的人你还得选个人去hold住他，免得醒来搞事情，话说带几根绳子咋这么困难呢！

（4）地图：本作地图较为简单，相比盟军2来说自由度并不高。在放弃了屋内模式后，对建筑物只保留了进出门及作为联通通道的功能，进入小屋的你宛如智障，随便哪个小兵进来干你都不会还手。在操作面板开启可互动项目高亮显示（其实这个功能很安逸）后物品就裸露开来，加上每个角色的道具是固定的，没有“隐藏物品”的存在，隐藏成就只在于“隐藏动作”，在这点上比之盟军2的丰富多变就相形见绌了。

（5）可能的小bug：比如妙义山潜入将军营帐的关卡，我用女忍一人独自潜入酒桶附近，就会提前说出“安眠药已制好可以投放了”这样的台词，虽说无关大局，但还是有点莫名其妙。还有最后一关的游戏提示全部不显示？我还以为是游戏故意设置的呢。



总而言之，这是一款很优秀的战术策略游戏，对得起杉果47的售价。虽然有盟军2珠玉在前，如今能再次玩到这样的游戏已实属幸运。作为一名喜欢单机游戏的玩家，我可以花大量的时间通关某个游戏，但是游戏的高下在于能否吸引我再次投入其中并乐此不疲。盟军2我玩了无数遍，其中的黑夜之狼和拯救史密斯这两关，是我没事就愿意打几遍的关卡，两者的共同之处就在于以小偷为主角进行秘密潜入，但这是因为小偷本身没有攻击能力造成了被动局面，反而刺激了在其他关卡里选择突突突的玩家为了“0杀”及“0发现”而挑战自我，但是在本作里你会发现每关都是在挑战自我...没有哪一关能靠刚正面获胜的，且由于武力有限导致游戏时间消耗过高（高玩除外），于是没有了把某一关多玩几遍的想法，所以拿成就大概是重复玩的主要动力了吧。

[spoiler]反正看完B站大佬们的骨灰级速通视频后我彻底放弃玩第二遍了...[/spoiler]



8/10推荐！



历史上真实的影子们到底是怎样的，我们无从得知。忠和义的抉择，从来都是难题。
这个影子小队，最后忠于的不是将军，而是无限的义，他们不是将军之刃，而是无限之刃。
玩过的人，应该都知道我在说什么。[spoiler]升华一下主题[/spoiler]

40444169.review:
I think quick save/save anywhere is the cancer of PC gaming. I purposely avoid games that let you save scum from start to finish. Sometimes it feels like game devs completely gave up on meaningful death penalty. By implementing quick save one throws immersion and challenge straight out of the window.

That said, in this case I made an exception and I am glad I did. This game has a beautiful soul and is masterfully crafted by very experienced devs and it shows. Apart from few minor bugs (like twitching characters when pathfinding through each other) the graphics, audio, gameplay and even japanese voice acting (!) are top notch. If you played Commandos or Desperados, you will be right at home.

If you are looking for a hardcore experience, this game can provide but only with self-imposed rules. Otherwise you can just mash F5 and try stupid shait with no punishment, no strategy, no thrill.

It's a pity that with 3 difficulty levels we still have none that is suitable for hardcore/challenge seeking gamers. Limiting number of available saves (+ save on exit) for hardcore difficulty would easily resolve my gripe with this game. Or at least checkpoints. Just get rid of this save scumming nonsense.

I would also welcome DLC and/or modding support.

Overall an extremely well done game with a fatal flaw (if you are looking for a challenge) that can be remedied with self-imposed rules.

40423760.review:
[b][u]-OVERALL:[/u][/b]                             9.25/10
  
Ok, so you like the old stealth RTS Commando serie ? Well this game might be just for you. I don't know if this game is some kind of hommage to our old Green Beret friend, but this game delivers ! Great game in every aspects, wish to see a sequel of some sorts soon. I strongly recommend to all players who appreciate either feudal japan, the commando serie, stealth RTS or just simply a good ol' game.


[b][u]-GAMEPLAY:[/u][/b]                            8.75/10

Classic RTS gameplay, when I first saw this I thought it was a reboot of the Commando serie in a feudal japan setting. It keeps the spirit of Commando, a stealthy RTS with different characters having respective skills. However Shadow Tactics brings a sweet cherry on top of the cake: shadow mode. It's like a tactical bullet time allowing you to prepare actions for each character that you can trigger whenever you see fit in a single clic. A real neat feature that creates for many various tactical approaches. Solid work all around !

[b][u]-LEVEL DESIGN:[/u][/b]                        9.5/10
 
All levels are well structured, you can approach them however you want, slow, fast, kill every body or nobody, only use 1 character or all of them. Take the obvious path or sneak around, some levels are snowy so now footprints becomes a big problem, some levels happen to be at night thus light sources are now your n1 issue, some levels will have lots of loud surfaces you can step on so now the sound you emit is your primary focus. The level design works like a well oiled machine hand in hand with its gameplay, it's various and dense.

[b][u]-VISUAL & ART:[/u][/b]                        9.5/10
   
Nearly perfect rendition of a Feudal japan setting, it's beautiful, colorful and coherent all throughout the game. Some parts of this game reminds me of some Kurosawa movies, primarly Kagemusha. And this is a true compliment to the team behind this game, amazing work !

[b][u]-SOUND & MUSIC:[/u][/b]                       8/10

The sound design is good, every action has its perfect audio cue. The japanese voice over are top notch, english is not as good in my opinion. Musics are also quite good although I wish it had only traditionnal japanese music, shamisen and all that good stuff for optimum immersion! 

[b][u]-REPLAYABILITY:[/u][/b]                       8.75/10

Take your time on your 1st playthrough on normal difficulty, play tight and complete the game on hardcore on your second time around then try getting some challenging badges and you'll easily get a lot of playtime out of this game.

The missions give you the freedom to tackle them from multiple paths. There isn't one set or optimal path generally. Use you imagination in how you want to tackle problems. I love that about this game.

The art? The animations? The setting? Simply beautiful. 

The characters all have personality and I genuinely enjoyed their story together and the interactions as much as I did playing the game itself.

There's a lot of life in this game. Your first play-through you're taking in the story, enjoying the levels. When you get done with that, you're then, after completing a level, seen what the challenges are to test yourself on the next go around.

All in all this is a must by and probably the best stealth game I've ever played.

40366757.review:
[h1]G'day here's my quick review summary [b][i][without spoilers][/i][/b][/h1]

[b]TL;DR: Should you buy it?[/b] If you understand the game won't hold your hand, or you are a fan of games like Desperados - Wanted Dead or Alive. Absolutely, and without hesitation! ✓

[h1][b]  ϟϟ Ratings ϟ ϟ [/b][/h1]

[b]Estimated Playtime Value: About 50+ hours[/b]
[b]My playtime: 44 Hours[/b]
[b]Refunded: [No][/b]
[b]Gameplay: 9.5/10[/b]
[b]Graphics: 9.5/10[/b]
[b]Sound: 8/10[/b]
[b]Story: 8.5/10[/b]
[b]Controls 8/10 [Used Mouse][/b]
[b]Replay Value: [Very High][/b]
[b]Price at time of review: €39.99[/b]
[b]Bugs: [Very Few][/b]
[b]Achievements gained: 60%[/b]
[b]Overall Value: 9/10[/b]

[h1][b] ϟϟ First Impressions ϟ ϟ [/b][/h1]

One of the best games I've ever played. A true homage to the likes of Desperados - Wanted Dead or Alive that performs incredibly well and gives me a great framework in which I can test my problem solving and reaction time.

[b]Best thing:[/b]  It's an incredible addition to a very small genre of fantastic games, I really wish there were more like this game.
[b]Liked:[/b]  Gorgeous graphics, medieval Japanese setting, satisfying tactical gameplay with great voice acting (I played with Japanese voices) and interesting story to uncover.

[b]Disliked:[/b]  The music score is as little bland

[h1][b]ϟϟ Funny ϟ ϟ[/b][/h1]

There's a bit of humour in the dialogue, some of the ways you can take out enemies is pretty funny; throwing a body off the top of a mountain is great.

[h1][b]2 Paragraph Full Review:[/b][/h1]

As most who are a fan of this genre know, that there is less than a handful of games like this in existence. Desperados - Wanted Dead or Alive runs in only 1024 x 768 (4:3) mode and requires a lot of messing about to get to work on a modern PC. This game is available in 1080p and can be supersampled at 4K, where it looks absolutely breathtaking. The fictional story is set in the medieval era of Japan (Edo period) and I found the story quite capticating and enjoyable albeit a little predictible.

Controls are pretty fluid, although sometimes a bit tricky to get used to as many methods require precise timing and quickly swapping between abilities and characters. I do not recommend playing with a controller. In general though you are only limited by your ability to think outside the box or not. The game truly rewards rule breakers and people who are fast and who meticulously plan out their method of attack. Because the learning curve is a bit steep no one could be blamed for buying the game, putting in about 10-20 hours and then putting it down for a while until they are in a patient enough mood to continue it. So many games allow us to learn their mechanics and find and exploit weaknesses so easily, ST:BotS gives you none of that - and expects an increasingly stellar performance from the gamer as you progress. It's great to play a game that expects you to being to understand it and visualise your success as you go.


[h1][b]Conclusion:[/b][/h1]

Even though there's so few games like ST:BotS, the game cannot be merited on this alone and honestly, it doesn't need to. ST:BotS is without a doubt one of my favourite games. It scratches an itch that I've had for over 12 years since playing Desperados: Wanted Dead or Alive. Finally now that I am older, I have both the patience and skill to totally finish and enjoy a game like this. ST:BotS requires you to think faster, develop quicker reflexes and really push the limits of your own skills, whilst at the same time further developing them. It's a fantastic experience, to play such a beautifully animated game with such incredible voice acting whilst also definitely becoming a better gamer. There are literally no cut corners in this game at all and as such, it is one of my easiest recommendations. If you can get it on a sale, then there's even more value to be had.

40343748.review:
Do you enjoy stealth games? If yes, this is an [u]absolute[/u] must buy. If not, then this game might not fit your bill.

It is slow and methodical. It gives the player every tool they could need, a 'plotting' option to really plot out their actions either individual or multiple (As in multiple characters moving simultaneously). Diverse and memorable characters.

The challenges really make you think and work. giving the 13 levels a lot of replayability. Im at 80hrs at the time of this review, and I still have another 20+hr to completion.

The only issue is the initial loading times into a level, which take a while, but once in, its smooth as butter. You wont have another long loading time until the next map. This problem is hardly that, and is easily over-looked by all the other polish this game has.

If you enjoy stealth games, you need this in your library. Words cannot exrpess how giddy youll feel when you assassinate 5 different guards at the exact same time and none of their allies are any the wiser.

If possible, I would like to recommend this twice. I cannot wait to see what Mimimi comes up with next, stealth or otherwise.

LYB战术:从入门苟到屠城(雾)
好玩到上瘾
一周目无攻略每过一关要一到两小时、回档几十次，我才玩到9/13
游戏难度比较高，要观察破绽、制定战术，要一点操作、比较繁琐但对速度要求不高，有AC游戏经验的道友上手应该容易一些
介绍里的人物名字和游戏里不一样，个人觉得游戏里个个都是人才、名字又好听
忍者 隼人(hayato)、孤儿猎人 友希(yuki 雪？)、武士 无限(mugen)、艺伎(其实是女忍者) 爱子(aiko)、狙击手老头(一大把年纪还能当狙击手) 琢磨(takuma)
为了shogun(将军)！！

==============================

时隔一天我又回来了
今天通关了，最后一关玩了4个小时，真的累。
哥几个都是刺客大师，大反派想切腹自尽死的体面？不存在的，上去就是一刀背刺不跟你多逼逼的好吧，嗯？你怎么说？
这游戏典型的先难后易，为了过开头的一条必经之路历经千难万险数次极限走位绕进敌军深处一个人一个人慢慢磨终于局势明朗了，其中琢磨老头由于机动性低、弹药稀少、地处低地，除了开枪的两分钟时间，不是蹲草里ob就是在去蹲草里ob的路上。但是有的场面还是必须要老头出面的，这个游戏这点很好，每个角色的能力都符合设定且各具特色，出场的没有一个是酱油的，所以如果发现卡关了就想想换个人物和组合，肯定有解法。
我还用最后的存档试了一下不同的杀法，但是只有三种：被刺客背刺死、被刺客扔海里淹死、被老头爆头死。是的没错琢磨大师可以杀昇老弟，但是你要让刺客把他打晕扔院子这边。有一招几层楼高直接扔院子里，但是居然没有摔死的死法，讲道理，我很难受。而扔海里是院子的相反方向，可怜的昇老弟每次自由落体都是头朝下的。
个人认为将军兄弟二人没什么的正邪之分，理念不同各为理想而已。影大人/昇的实力有多少好像没有描述，最后一关的府邸的确蛮气派的，倒是他老哥、咱们的将军大人，说是爱好和平，然后带着三十万大军去京都见天皇去了。。。哇屌的不行，老哥你这架势是见天皇还是当天皇？
总之这款游戏又难又好玩，我用的手柄，熟悉操作了以后用起来还是挺舒服的，键鼠没用过，好像有的键一只手按不过来。关于价格，115有点贵，但是游戏的确对得起这个价格，打折的时候要尽量把握啊。。。。。。
其实我是过年时候买的杉果的38块抽奖抽的这个游戏，抽出来我朋友说这游戏特别好、他就想抽这个和生化7，生化7？不存在的！菜逼有种玩给我看看？

40292785.review:
日本(?)を舞台にしたクリック移動タイプのステルスゲーム。将軍に仕える5人を操作して、敵に見つからないように行動しながら様々なミッションをこなしていく。

マップ内には数多くの敵がいて、警戒している。その敵の目から逃れたり、ときに闇の内に消し去ったりして、任務をこなしていく。敵の兵士には視界があり、その視界内に一定時間いたり、その中で不審な行動をしたいすると見つかって追いかけられる。敵の視界を表示したり、指定ポイントを敵が見ているかどうかを確認することができるので、それらを参考に行動を考えることができる。また敵の死体が別の敵に見つかったりしても警戒状態になる。闇から闇へ移動し、倒した敵の痕跡さえも消し去る。それこそが忍びの道となる。

ゲーム内容はけっこうシビアで、見つかるとほぼ失敗。こまめなセーブとやり直しが必須となってくる。状況に応じた素早い判断と操作も必要になることはあるが、それよりもとにかくじっくり練った作戦が重要となる。

5人のキャラクターはそれぞれ特徴があり、異なった技を持っている。なぜか手裏剣を１個しか持っていない、いかにも忍者なハヤト。若い女の子なのに仕掛け罠で敵をサクサク葬っていくユキちゃん。剣術に長けたマッチョ侍のムゲン。変装が得意で敵の中を自由に行動できる大人なくノ一のアイコ。そして銃と薬の扱いに長けた爺さんのタクマ。攻撃に関するものだけでなく、敵の注意をひきつけたり、敵の視界を奪ったりと、隠密に役に立つスキルがいろいろある。

キャラクターの操作は、個々のキャラクターにリアルタイムで行動を入力する他に、先に複数人に命令を設定しておいて一気に作戦を実行させることもできる。例えば３人の敵それぞれにターゲットを定めて、一気に殲滅したり、銃で弱らせると同時に切りかかったり、目くらましを投げつけてその間に一気に距離を詰めたり。一人ひとりの入力では切り抜けられないようなシチュエーションでも、この同時行動でなんとか切り抜けられる場合も少なくない。

世界観はほぼ日本。ただし海外から見たちょっと不思議な日本。将軍が後光を背負っていたり、庭園が中国風だったり、将軍の弟の名前がノボルだったり。音声も日本語吹き替えされているのだけれど、これもところどころ不思議翻訳で、声優さんは大変だっただろうなあと余計な心配をしてしまう。台詞の中で「リロードする」とか「ただのヘアピンよ」とか微妙に英語混じりになるのもまたご愛嬌。

シビアでセーブ＆やり直し必須ではあるけれど、それが苦にならない頭を仕えるゲーム。また「絶対無理」と思っていた局面で、作戦がかっちりハマって上手く行ったときの脳汁の出はハンパない。そんなゲームです。

40252650.review:
I can only recommend this game if you are experienced with, and enjoy this style of game. Otherwise I wouldn't recommend it. I'm aware of the overwhelmingly positive reviews, hear me out.

I usually play traditional  RPGs, tactical battlers, some action shooters, and ARPGs. I bought this game because I love feudal Japan period and I have fond memories of Commandos. I gave it a shot, it's not for me.  Here's why I wouldn't recommend it to anyone other than lovers of this genre:

1.  This is barely 'tactics'. Yes when you have more than 2 characters on the map there is some tactics but otherwise there's a lot of restiction of what can actually be done. 
2. It's very linear. despite the large playmaps, they mostly have 1 or 2 set paths/formulas to solve them. There's a few environmental type traps dotted around to interact with but not a lot. The outside maps have slightly more 'open world' but the villages/building rich maps mostly have a path to follow (roof hooks, jumpable roofs etc).
3. The skill in this game is pattern memorization and timing. It's like playing an action platformer where you need to get your timing spot on. Basically memorize the guard patrols and time your moves between view cones. 
4. Very trial & error (I suppose most games are trial and error to some extent). It's a quickload spammer. And very frustrating in parts.
5. I would of liked control on who (which characters) to bring to each mission. Then we'd have a proper tactics game and proper  problem solving.

Otherwise:

1. Really loved the feudal Japan setting and theme.
2. Graphics are really nice.
3. Game runs well, no glitches or bugs that I came across.
4. Good selection of achievements, badges, awards, challenges etc that can be earned.

I can see it's a quality game and a lot of people are enjoying it, but I honestly can't receommend it to anyone but lovers of this particular genre.

40163211.review:
I'm not entirely in love with strategy games so it takes a lot for me to get engaged. That being said, Shadow Tactics is a masterpiece and I can't believe it doesn't have more people playing it. It really makes you feel like a ninja in a way that most stealth games really can't. It is so satisfying seeing a daunting task a head of you with a crapton of guards and thinking, "There is no way I'll be able to figure this out," only to find yourself silently picking them off one by one and getting your whole team past the enemy guards. Either that, or you can cheese the bad guys with a technicality :P Either way, do NOT pass on this game, if you can spare the money.

That being said, if I did have any criticism of it, I'd have 2 points to bring up. Number 1, I really hate the interspliced British accents. Some people have Japanese accents (which makes sense because they're in Japan), but some people have inexplicable British accents. Would much rather have preferred if they all had Japanese accents since it breaks the immersion a little. Number 2, the story is a little too clear cut. The story brings you from setting to setting rather nicely, as you can be fighting in the middle of a warzone one mission then in the middle of a rainy ricefield the next. I guess when I say story, I mean characters. Outside of the main cast of 5 playable characters (who are acceptably fleshed out and more, don't get me wrong), you only see like 3 other main characters, which makes any twist kind of impossible.

Still, despite this, I absolutely adore this game and I'll be watching the developer very closely :)

40158176.review:
I'm struggling to compose a review that'd do this game justice. The concept of a stealth-RTS game is unique enough that only 2 predecessors exist (Commandos and Desperados). Commandos was the first of its kind, set in WW2 but completely 2D (no 3D, no rotatable camera).  Older/more experienced gamers will probably know all about this one already. (No idea how Desperados relates, since people say this game is a mix of both but don't elaborate on what Desperados had. If you're thinking of getting either of these classics, I recommend buying through GOG instead of Steam, they actually make sure their old games can run on newer systems, whereas Steam sells them as they are, with zero modifications.)

Have you ever hoped that the brotherhood feature in Assassin's Creed games allowed for more tactical maneuverability than the single press of a button it turned out to be, where a few assassins dropped in, killed any hostiles in the vicinity then ran off? Where you could plan distractions, time your routes and generally not just have to resort to hacking your way through the enemy? This game is basically that feature, taken and expanded into its own game, set in feudal Japan (imo, one of the best historical settings ever).

Your party is a band of 5 (full disclosure: you only play with all 5 together for technically 2 levels, both in the later part of the game); 3 ninjas, a sniper (and his pet tanuki), and a samurai, who is effectively the protagonist, as he works directly for the Shogun. The story is far from the main aspect of the game: the Shogun, wanting to maintain peace in the region, stamps out a couple of rebellions by sending his blades to infiltrate, reconnoiter, and sabotage where they can. There is a badge system (9 badges for each of the 13 levels - 7 if you don't count the hardcore and speedrun badges) for the completionists out there.

Can't think of many reasons to buy this game over not, except that it works, has VERY few bugs, and is a high-quality creation in a niche game genre (stealth RTS - RTS in that it has the top-down look, and the entire map is dynamic with so many moving parts/people). There is a lot of detail and attention put into every single level, to the point that you see speedrunners frequently use them to their advantage. Also the quicksave/quickload system (save-scumming) puts this game above Commandos.

The downsides are that any bugs encountered usually break the flow/game, like a certain level where a dude is supposed to walk constantly back and forth between 2 spots in a bathhouse, but at some point he will stop moving if you're not fast enough (devs confirmed it was a scripting error, and said they'd patch in the update that would sync with console release, but apparently people are still having issues). Speedrun badges are a headache too, since the game still counts the time you'd already spent, when you reload. Shadow mode not actually freezing the map is another thorn in my side, and [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197969712114/recommended/418240/]this guy[/url] highlights this particular issue a lot better than I could ever hope to (didn't experience any problems with AI or camera controls myself).

Seems a little hypocritical to recommend this game even at full price, when I got it for £10 in a Humble Monthly, but the amount of effort evident in this gem should show you that it's worth it.

If you do decide to get this game, make sure your first playthrough of every level is on hardcore difficulty, so you can experience how tough this game can really get (you'll be save-scumming anyway).

40078481.review:
I guess all of us have games that we used to love back in the days, but can't find anything like them on modern market. Times changed and now there are many dead, or half-dead genres and sub-genres. Space simulators, rail shooters... Even real-time strategies and puzzle / point & click adventures aren't doing well now. Among all that there's a small [b]RTS[/b] sub-genre that was never really big, but still made a lot of loyal fans. I'm talking about [b]Commandos[/b] series and its clones. An unique mix of stealth and [b]RTS[/b] with revolutionary “cons of sight” system. By controlling group of soldiers with the unique set of abilities, players were supposed to finish different missions in [b]WWII[/b] setting. The first two [b]Commandos[/b] games (released in [b]1998[/b] and [b]2001[/b] respectively) were absolutely brilliant and it felt like their makers, [b]Pyro Studios[/b], are making instant classic. Unfortunately, the third [b]Commandos[/b] game wasn't that popular thanks to many questionable changes in the gameplay, while [b]FPS[/b] spin-off called [b]Commandos: Strike Force[/b] started the dark times for [b]Pyro Studios[/b]. Which switched to casual games soon after that. [b]Commandos[/b] series died. [i]But[/i] there was another team to keep their spirit alive.

In [b]2001[/b] (the same year with [b]Commandos 2[/b]) [b]German[/b] developer [b]Spellbound Entertainment[/b] released a game called [b]Desperados: Wanted Dead or Alive[/b]. And guess what? It was an exact copy of the first [b]Commandos[/b]. Just with more options and in [b]Wild West[/b] setting. Later, [b]Spellbound Entertainment[/b] will release two sequels to [b]Desperados[/b] and also two games of that kind in different settings. [b]Robin Hood: The Legend of Sherwood[/b] and [b]Chicago 1930[/b]. [b]Robin Hood: The Legend of Sherwood[/b] used to include advanced sword fights, while [b]Chicago 1930[/b] that was heavily inspired by [b]Brian De Palma[/b]'s cult movie [b]The Untouchables[/b], allowed us to play both as police and mafia. In other words, [b]Spellbound[/b] loved the genre and wanted to make more games in different settings. At some point they even planned a game called [b]Vampire Hunter[/b] in dark [b]Bram Stoker[/b]'s setting. A few screenshots exist, but unfortunately, the game itself was never released.

Why am I telling you all that? Well, because that's where the story of the entire sub-genre pretty much ends. After [b]Spellbound[/b] came to an end in [b]2012[/b], nobody really tried to make a proper game like that. Even ex-[b]Spellbound[/b] employees, who decided to stay in business and returned as [b]Black Forest Games[/b], showed no interest in such games. [b]Spellbound[/b] died and it looked like the spirit of [b]Commandos[/b] died with them. Until now. [b]Mimimi Productions[/b], another [b]German[/b] developer, came and... here we are. Meet [b]Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun[/b]! The first proper [b]Commandos[/b] clone since forever.

And I must say, it's a [i]huge[/i] success. Mostly because [b]Mimimi Productions[/b] didn't try to alter the formula much. [b]Spellbound[/b]'s worst game of the kind was probably [b]Chicago 1930[/b]. Just because they tried too many different things at the same time. While the worst [b]Commandos[/b] was the third one. For the same exact reason. Too many new ideas that didn't really work out. The original formula was so good that there was literally no need for anything else. And [b]Mimimi[/b] understood that. Aside from the fact that [b]Shadow Tactics[/b] is a fully [b]3D[/b] game (the concept was polished enough before in [b]Desperados 2[/b] and [b]Helldorado[/b] and now it feels good and comfortable like never before), it's [i]the[/i] [b]Commandos[/b] that we all know and love. Actually, [b]Mimimi[/b] copied everything so well that most of your old skills from [b]Commandos[/b] and [b]Desperados[/b] will work here as well. It's like playing them all over again, really.

Of course, setting this time will be different. In [b]Shadow Tactics[/b] we have [b]Edo[/b] jidai [b]Japan[/b] ([b]1603[/b] – [b]1868[/b]) and a story about [b]Shōgun[/b] and the mysterious rebel leader [b]Kage[/b]-sama. But aside from that, there's pretty much no differences. Actually, even plot feels a lot like story from the very first [b]Desperados[/b]. I mean, [b]El Diablo[/b], [b]Kage-sama[/b]... you've got the idea. As for the characters and their abilities... those may look different, but technically, it's the same thing all over again. Like tanuki [b]Kuma[/b] will play a role of [b]Jack O'Hara[/b]'s radio, shurikens feel exactly like [b]James Blackwood[/b]'s throwing knives, a character called [b]Aiko[/b] is pretty much the same with [b]Natasha Nikochevski[/b] from expansion to the first [b]Comamndos[/b], etc.

In other words, [b]Shadow Tactics[/b] is like [b]Commandos[/b] in feudal [b]Japan[/b] setting. Or [b]Desperados[/b], because [b]Mimimi[/b] kept the best thing about the first [b]Desperados[/b] – the ability to give orders to the characters beforehand to perform at the same exact time. Remember [b]Quick Action[/b] from [b]Desperados[/b]? [b]Shadow Mode[/b] from [b]Shadow Tactics[/b] is exactly the same thing.

All that is kinda fun. Because usually when the game tries to copy another one so much, it's a bad thing. Usually, nobody likes clones. But this time... this time it's different. First of all, we didn't see anything like that for [i]ages[/i]. Second, in such games you don't really want anything new. You just want more. More missions. More, more and more. And [b]Shadow Tactics[/b] provides exactly that. Finally, it's a really well-made game. It looks very good for [b]Unity[/b] game, soundtrack is extremely charming and captures the mood very well, characters are very solid, while voices... Well, that's what I loved the most. Usually, when [b]English[/b]-speaking actors try to act like [b]Japanese[/b] people, it's a disaster. So, [b]Mimimi[/b] did an absolutely brilliant thing. They just hired [b]Japanese[/b] actors. Problem solved. Yep, this game has [b]Japanese[/b] voiceover. How cool is that? The answer is – [i]extremely[/i] cool. Personally, I think that every game with [b]Japanese[/b] characters should do exactly that. There's an [b]English[/b] voices too, though, in case if you want them. Everybody's happy.

So, in conclusion, [b]Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun[/b] is a big comeback of [b]Commandos[/b]-like games. Extremely charming, extremely well-made and without any needless details. If you ever liked games from [b]Pyro[/b], or [b]Spellbound[/b], don't you even dare to miss the one from [b]Mimimi[/b]. The guys did [i]perfect[/i] job and the only thing I want to ask them... [i]Please, make a sequel!!![/i]

40023019.review:
影战虐我千百遍，我仍待之如初恋。

耗时43小时完全没看攻略通关一周目。从1个小时1章节，到2小时，4小时...确实没想到，普通模式就这么难，相比于另一个同样让我头疼与难舍的游戏，杀手6，似乎还是影战在磨人和难度上更胜一筹。然而就是这么让人难的头疼的游戏，却吸引我无论多困难都坚持到了最后通关，因为它好玩！足够优秀！好评如潮就是好评如潮，不是盖的。

“影子战术”，是这个游戏的标题以及这个游戏的标志性玩法，利用五人组同时暗杀多个目标来达到将警报压制在萌芽阶段的目的，最终完成暗杀，却又尽量不惊动任何人。然而这游戏在敌人机敏上和敌人小地区密度上达到了一个新的高度，而使难度倍增，所以完全不惊动敌人是不太可能的。但是合理惊动敌人有时绝对是打破僵局的利器，当你发现，琢磨老爷子的狙也不方便用到，影子战术也不好实施的时候，不妨用火枪或者隼人的手里剑、友希的陷阱先搞死关键位置的敌人。有些位置会补人，但大多时候死一个就少一个。警报会让道路上增加巡逻的三人组，但是在影子战术面前，这反而不是问题。同时提一句：不要吝啬你的保存键f5，每安全搞死一个人就保存一下不会让你吃亏的，你只会庆幸。

而在游戏的bgm上，古风与悲壮相融合的主页面曲、加载页面曲让我越听越喜欢[strike]（http://music.163.com/#/album?id=35065084）[/strike]我很高兴网易云原声音乐全都有。虽然需要会员才能下载，但对于喜欢的人来说：找不到，比花钱更痛苦。（音乐貌似有版权保护，链接点出来无效。直接上网易云搜影子战术也能搜到）

总评：9.5/10，扣去0.5是因为这游戏确实太难了~~（PS：推荐打折时购买更划算，原价虽然我觉得这游戏也配得上，但能便宜干嘛不便宜呢）

39959854.review:
This is a great game. I remember playing the Starcraft 2: Nova Covert Ops campaign a year or so ago and thinking that the best thing about it was the stealth missions, and wishing that they had leaned more on that element of the campaign. Enter Shadow Tactics. Thirteen missions of nothing but sneaking around, with five fun characters each with their own unique set of sneaky tools. I found the characters themselves to be enjoyable, which is especially impressive since the game lacks any true prerendered cutscenes. You don't really see their faces much outside the UI portraits; instead we get to know the characters through dialogue, which is well-written. Both the English and Japanese voicework are great, though I prefer the English audio because it's hard to follow the subtitles and focus on sneaking at the same time. And like I said their dialogues are actually very effective so I felt like I was missing out on something whenever I switched it to Japanese.

It's hard! But there's an easy mode. There's also a hardcore mode if the normal difficulty isn't hard enough. There are all kinds of medals/acheivements that really make it fun to revisit a mission you've already completed. All around this game was a top-notch experience that I really can't recommend highly enough. A couple things to note that I wish I knew going in:

1. if you are spotted and fail to kill the enemy before the alarm is raised, they will actually call in additional guards, and these additional guards won't necessarily leave when the alarm ends. There was a mission where this happened and it made part of the mission literally unpassabe because of the extra guards, so I had to start over.
2. make good use of the quicksave feature (F5). The game stores up to 3 quicksaves and these really come in handy if you mess up and need to redo part of a level to avoid the issue mentioned above.
3. when the male characters carry a dead body, (to hide or dispose of it) they move more quickly than female characters do because they stand upright to carry them. This is a trade-off, as it means you are much more visible to other enemies, even from a distance. While the female characters are much slower when it comes to moving bodies, they drag them in a crouching position so they are able to avoid detection by hiding in bushes or sticking to the outer radius of enemy veiwcones. TL,DR: Depending on the situation, you may need to deliberately choose whether to use a male character or a female character move a body.

39934287.review:
(Writing quality may degrade over time, I think I exceeded Steam's max character count...)

TL; DR: Great game, highly recommended, would definitely play future instalments, may consider trying the game's predecessors

I was a little hesitant to play this when it was first recommended to me on Steam, having had a period of playing titles I knew and loved, but I decided to take the risk of purchasing this game; particularly because of the setting and characters which I am a fan of (ninjas, samurai, Japan etc). That risk paid off!

Shadow Tactics is a fun and immersive game which challenges players right from the first level. The game progression between different level conditions along with the different types of enemies makes each level challenging in its own particular way.

Level conditions include:
Day/night - You're less visible during night, but most guards patrol with torches at night
Snow - enemies can track your footprints if they see a trail in the snow
Water - travelling through bodies of water could alert guards to your location (even if you think you're well hidden); depends on how fast you're wading through.

Enemies include:
Standard guards - Generally patrolling around an area, fairly easy to defeat or evade (subject to change based on the area you're in)
Straw hats - stationary guards who usually guards entrances/exits and won't fall for any attempts to move them away from their posts
Long range firearms - sniper-type enemies who are usually positioned in towers or on the rooftops
Samurai - Generally the most troublesome enemy, they can only be killed directly by other Samurai (ie Mugen) or if they're temporarily stunned with gunfire beforehand, they're heavier to carry around, don't typically pay much attention to Kuma's distraction attempts and can see right through Aiko's Geisha disguise.
Civilians - some are friendly, some require saving, however some are hostile and will alert a guard if they spot anything suspicious (ie you, dead bodies etc)

A little more info about the playable characters (based on memory from playing the game a few months ago):

- All characters have a close range attack, except Takuma who relies on guns, explosives and raccoons
- All characters get guns (basic flintlock-type pistol) (as the story progresses)
- All characters can carry bodies, except Takuma who doesn't care about proving he's not 'that old' yet
- All characters have a health-pack-thing, however it's entirely possible to complete the game without using them (only needed if engaging in direct combat)
- All characters are fairly vulnerable to direct damage and swarms of guards; it's possible to get out of said situation (depending on the amount of guards fighting and the players available) and usually consists of spamming the close-range attacks unless you use Mugen's multi-kill special ability or Takuma's bombs
- Hayato, Aiko and Yuki can use hook-like-things to quickly get up to rooftops, however there may be times where taking the stairs are more appropriate
- All characters can hide in certain buildings, going through one door and out the other to reach other areas, however some enemy patrol routes include using these walkways too, so they may spot you
- Bodies can be hidden in bushes, buildings, thrown off cliffs or into large 'bodies' of water

Hayato the ninja - The lone ranger and strategies guy
- Shuriken for short-mid range kills (Shuriken requires retrieving before re-use)
- Rocks, because why not? Used to distract enemies (infinite use)

Mugen the Samurai - The tank class
- Special ability can kill multiple enemies in the immediate vicinity (if they're grouped together, chatting/procrastinating)
- Bottle/flask of Saké, distracts standard enemies who want to pick it up (and get drunk) (Saké requires retrieving before re-use, otherwise the guard takes it)
- Stronger and can carry 2 bodies at once, whilst still able to walk at a normal pace

Aiko the Kunoichi - The proto-feminist who likes stealing other people's clothes to cosplay as a Geisha, sometimes rivals Hayato in strategies
- Powder-bomb-thing, temporarily reduces the visibility of enemies
- Geisha cosplay, allows her to casually walk around and mingle with the guards, any actions considered majorly 'ninja-like' will force her to remove her disguise (ie carrying bodies) (requires retrieval of clothes from another Geisha before use). Takes a bit of time for her to get changed so best not to use whilst a pervy guard is staring at her (no nudity involved)

Yuki the street girl - The killer, decoy and trap-maker
- Basic trap, lures guards to their death, requires Yuki to walk over and make the trap before hiding (requires retrieval if you're not happy with the trap's location). Can't be detected by basic guards but anyone who falls for the trap will be spotted by onlookers.
- Bird whistles, distracts standard guards from their spots/patrol routes
- Takes the longest to hide bodies (everyone else walks or runs)

Takuma marksman - The old geezer with the raccoon, also a part-time inventor (long range weapons only)
- Peg leg-sniper, provides long range damage to a specific enemy (limited use)
- Bombs, capable of killing multiple enemies within the vicinity, very loud and can attract guards in vicinity (limited use)
- Kuma the raccoon, used to distract enemies for a decent period of time, can be moved independently of Takuma (within a limited distance, if Kuma moves outside Takuma's range, then they will both move towards the new location to make sure Kuma remains within range) can be used infinitely, however Kuma requires moving to another spot if trying to distract the same enemy more than once, can open doors to reach other levels (clever raccoon!). Can single-handedly infiltrate a castle as he doesn’t alert guards or engage in combat (like a boss).

Other features:
- Fairly big levels, which are really challenging to complete but still possible to do so, just takes time, patience and lots of planning/strategies
- Killing all the enemies isn't required to complete each level, however picking them out one at a time makes it easier to kill the next guy
- Different set of characters per level (Personally I preferred playing as all of them in one level, once you reach the main target of a level who is well guarded, you could perform an Assassin's Creed-esque stunt to take out pretty much everyone in the area before they have time to react)
- Custom checkpoints and Shadow mode are really useful, however they are both a blessing and a curse (will explain in the comments if anyone is curious)
- Some levels have more than one way of getting in/around (maybe take a horse and cart instead of walking up to the enemy camp, dress as a geisha to spy instead of hide in bushes etc)
- Plot twists [spoiler]RIP person that dies[/spoiler]
- The title screen animation is great - I find it pretty mesmerizing 

The only negatives I have:
- Levels take a while to load, I get that they're big but they're pre-set levels, it's not like everyone has different levels to play (or do they...)
- Limited tutorial, it tells you about the character's main abilities, but there's nothing about controlling the players (point & click), changing terrain (climbing, jumping between platforms etc). I played it once, got stuck and didn't know where to go (needed to jump right at the beginning of the game), left the game to play something else, and returned to play a while later.
- Story is a little repetitive in some places in the sense that some players get captured and require rescuing, or players split up and take on the entire map from 2 different entry points more than once.

I haven't played any of the predecessors (Commandos/Desperados), or really heard of them, but I may well give them a go now. But if there was more to the Shadow Tactics series, I would definitely consider playing it, plus this game has encouraged me to go out of my way and spend my money on other games from here I may not have considered before.

39807057.review:
I am absolutely loving this game!  It is one of those rare gems that I decided to take a chance on, since I am new to this genre.  I had previously never even heard of the genre and games which many reviewers reference, such as "Commandos or Deperados."  With so many positive reviews, I decided to give it a try, and although I am still less than half way through my first play-through of the game, it has already landed on my list of favorite games ever.

PROS
-The game is very challenging, yet forgiving.  You need to constantly devise plans to either eliminate the ememy or slip past them.  Many times you will fail, but you just re-load to try again, all the while learning from your mistakes.  Challenge without frustration.

-The story is really, really good.
-The characters you play as part of your team are very likeable.
-The music is amazing.
-I love every map I have played so far.  They have all felt very different, each having its own unique mission, layout, and feel.
-The maps are simply beautiful.
-The badges offer a whole new level of challenge that give the maps re-playability.  Even though I am less than half-way through my first play through, I am already going back to the previously completed maps to try to earn new badges, which simply encourage different tactical approaches to the map.
-The game is just down right fun.  I cannot tell you how many times I have laughed after one of my little schemes succeeded in elimating my targets!  The weapons/tools available to use can be downright fun.
-The game trains you as you progress through maps, but the "training" maps, such as the first Osaka map, have great re-playability.  I think the game is very good at training you to play. You initially learn the actions, controls, and keymap, all the while learning some good tactical approaches which your character conversations or in-game tips will suggest.  After a few maps, you will be a master at the controls.


CONS:
-In the end, I have no Cons.  Initially, being new to the genre, I had to learn how to play a real-time tactics game.  Leave Rambo at home and bring your inner ninja to play instead.  But... there are definitely times where a Rambo solution works :).
-The controls: Initially, the controls were very foreign to me.  It takes a LOT to break the habit of trying to move a character with the WASD keys lol!  When I first got the game, I played for about 30 mins on the Osaka map, learning the concepts and controls.  I hated the controls.  But, I came back, because the game is amazing, and after a few maps and some trial and error re-keymapping to my personal preferences, the controls now feel completely natural!  

SUMMARY:
This game is simply fun to play.  It offers great challenge without frustration... a great story, characters, music, maps, graphics, etc.  You examine the bigger picture... a larger system, then you work to dismantle it piece by piece... all the while having a lot of fun doing so.

I've read a lot of reviews that say this is the best game of a long lost genre.  Well, from my perspective, having never known the genre, this is just the first game of what I hope will be a very, very long line of "Shadow Tactics" games.

39796411.review:
Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun is one of the most challenging stealth games I've ever played. You take control of five assassins, each one of them with a specific set of skills, in a mission to find Kage-sama, a misterious rebel who threatens the period of peace that has been established by the Shogun. 
None of the characters can do everything, but all of them are needed. Learning to make their skills work together is the key to success in this game. Enemies are often either looking at each other or forming patrols, so you'll have to plan ahead and master distractions, coordination and quick execution.

It's not for everyone though. This game heavily relies on quicksaves, to the point that it even warns you if you haven't saved in a while. Technically, if you happen to be a master tactician, you can play the game in one go without a problem, but it's likely that you will end up stuck somewhere forced into a trial and error loop until you succeed. This means it can be quite frustrating at times, so be ready for that.

Other than that, fantastic game. If you like stealth games, and specially if you like challenging ones, you'll love it.

39747845.review:
Just as torturously difficult as the old Commandos games. This toy Shinobi/Samurai problem solving sim is not for the short tempered as you control a small team of up to five Japanes characters to undertake objectives often against seemingly impossible odds. Strangely addictive, I have played it through on the easiest (moron) mode and it is till quite challenging if you are more used to a quick shoot 'em up. Carefull planning and strategy become more necessary to achieve objectives as the game goes on, often relying on the trusty F5 quick save which once engrossed by gameplay can be overlooked to ones detriment and a hefty need to scream swear words at yourself for being neglectful of this function.

To be critical the game does start to become slightly formulaic as one progresses. Lacking in imagination (propbably 
on my part) I usually resort to the systematic culling of all enemies to facilitate completion of the mission. This often relies on a repetitiious distract and destroy strategy frequently using the same spot (bottom of climbing vines is good for a quick escape) as the AI does not always work out the simple strategy and the bodies pile up. Two golden rules - SAVE via F5 before attemting ANYTHING and ALWAYS secure dormant players where they will no get seen whilst you are busy elsewhere on the map.Although the game gives tips to use the 'shift' key to multitask players simultaneousy to solve harder problems I found I often lacked trust in the execution and things could often go wrong although very satisfying when they do go right.

Overall this game is a bit of fun and has a reasonably strong story line to keep one interested. Certain scenes of 'Seppuku' may be unsuitable for small children engrossed in the plot. The graphics are quite cartoon like but they suit the style of game and the music is excellently atmospheric throughout. I thnk as my skills have gradually  increased it has a replayable factor making it good value, offering hours of entertainment for those patient enough to endure.I am personally not bothered about multi-player but would certainly give it a go if it became available........?
